H0.text: It will melt to form liquid water when a large piece of ice is placed on the sidewalk on a warm day.

H1.text: It will melt to form water vapor when a large piece of ice is placed on the sidewalk on a warm day.

H2.text: It will freeze to form liquid water is what will happen to a large piece of ice placed on the sidewalk on a warm day.

H3.text: It will not change at all when a large piece of ice is placed on the sidewalk on a warm day.

A4.text: At a pressure of one atmosphere (atm), ice melts or water freezes (solidifies) at 0 °C (32 °F)

A5.text: In addition it is unusual as it becomes significantly less dense as it freezes, though it is not unique in that respect
